article.title: High-resolution imaging spectroscopy of two micro-pores and an arch filament system in a small emerging-flux region

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of solar feature is the primary subject of the broadband image (top) in Figure 1?
Which instrument was used to acquire the data shown in Figure 1?
What does the white rectangle on the left side of the Ha line-core intensity image (bottom) in Figure 1 indicate?
choices: The location of an arch filament system (AFS)
The region used for computing the average quiet-Sun spectral profile
The area covered by the micro-pores

multiple_choice_question.text: How are the micro-pores identified in the Ha line-core intensity image (bottom) in Figure 1?
choices: As areas of suppressed horizontal proper motions

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of data is presented in Figure 2?
What do the \'+\' symbols in Figure 2 represent?
choices: Positions of the micro-pores seen in Figure 1
Regions of strong magnetic flux emergence

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate cadence of the magnetograms shown in the first row of Figure 2?
What can be concluded about the evolution of the magnetic field in the emerging flux region (EFR) based on Figure 2?
choices: The magnetic flux remains constant throughout the observation period.
The positive polarity emerges first, followed by the negative polarity.
The EFR exhibits the typical magnetic configuration for the 23rd solar cycle, with the positive polarity leading.
The negative polarity patch is more extended than the positive polarity patch.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information is presented in the top panel of Figure 8?
choices: Horizontal flow speed around the micro-pores

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the gray background in Figure 8 indicate?
choices: The 17 time sequences with the best seeing conditions
Periods of high magnetic flux emergence
Time intervals with strong downflows in the micro-pores
The lifetime of the emerging flux region (EFR)

multiple_choice_question.text: According to the linear fits shown in Figure 8, what is the approximate rate at which the total area of the micro-pores decreases (dAmp/dt)?
Based on the trends shown in Figure 8, what is the most likely fate of the decaying micro-pores?
choices: They will merge to form a larger pore.
They will be advected away from each other by horizontal flows.
They will remain stable in size and intensity.
